intro: Centaurium floribundum, commonly known as the common centaury, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Gentianaceae. It is native to Europe and parts of western Asia, typically growing in grassy areas and along roadsides. The plant produces small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a hairy texture. Centaurium floribundum is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
